pageContext.claim: “Yes, I do have an absolute right to pardon myself.  But I’ll never have to do it because I didn’t do anything wrong.  And everybody knows it.  There’s been no collusion.  There’s been no obstruction.  It’s all a made-up fantasy.  It’s a witch hunt.  No collusion, no obstruction, no nothing.”
pageContext.analysis: This startling claim would likely be challenged all the way to the Supreme Court, if Trump actually took this politically perilous step. Legal scholars would dispute whether Trump has an "absolute right" to self-pardon since it's never been tested.
